main event: At 0320 PST on 26 Aug 52, an unidentified flying object was observed in the vicinity of Silver Lake, Calif. The object was spherical, brilliantly illuminated, halted momentarily, then turned sharply and entered a steep climb at greatly accelerated speed before extinguishing its light and leaving a victor shaped contrail for one second.
interesting points: The object approached at a height of three to eight thousand feet and turned northeastward around Lathrop Wells, Nevada, with the entire duration of the sighting being three to five seconds.
There was no exhaust until the sharp climb began, and there were no known air activities or meteorological disturbances at the time.
The sighting occurred under C.U.N.D.E. (Ceiling Unlimited, Visibility Unlimited) weather conditions.
No physical evidence or photographs were obtained from the sighting.
The ground observer's report was considered credible.
